content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Define the start and end of Julia code blocks
    start_code_fence = "```julia"
    end_code_fence = "```"

    # Initialize an empty string to collect all Julia code blocks
    collected_code = ""

    # Split the markdown document by lines to process it
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize a flag to check if we are inside a Julia code block
    inside_code_block = false

    # Iterate through each line of the markdown document
    for line in lines
        # Check if the line is the start of a Julia code block
        if occursin(start_code_fence, line)
            inside_code_block = true
            continue  # Skip the current iteration to not include the fence in the code
        end

        # Check if the line is the end of a code block
        if occursin(end_code_fence, line) && inside_code_block
            inside_code_block = false
            # Add a newline after each code block except the last one
            collected_code *= "\n"
            continue  # Skip the current iteration to not include the fence in the code
        end

        # If the line is inside a Julia code block, add it to the collected_code
        if inside_code_block
            # If not the first line of the code block, append a newline before appending the code
            if !isempty(collected_code)
                collected_code *= "\n"
            end
            collected_code *= line
        end
    end

    return strip(collected_code) # Remove leading and trailing whitespace/newlines
end
```
